q: San Francisco- Chrysler CEO Sergio Marchionne says the company will run a two-minute commercial in the third quarter of the Super Bowl on Sunday, as part of the company's efforts to recast its image. I won't tell you what it's about but its worth watching, Sergio Marchionne said at a forum sponsored by JD Power at a hotel here ahead of the National Automobile Dealers Association three-day convention. political operatives say he must do if he hopes to be re-elected.`` The jury is still out on which way the Bill Clinton is going to go,'' said Greg Mueller , a Republican political strategist. Will he continue to draw lines in the sand far to the left of the electorate or is he going to lurch to the middle the way Bill Clinton did to see if he can come back? The State of the Union is the kickoff of his re-election campaign. `` For a Democratic Bill Clinton to win, you have to move to the center,'' said Mike Pence Martin, a Democratic operative from Missouri.`` This country is not ready for a pure progressive.

As he notes, it was, after all, Martin Luther Day in Montgomery. It was the inaugural, the same event George Will Wallace used in 1963 to wave his` segregation forever' fist at the federal government. Bentley's words that day`` burn like a bad memory,'' and a worse testament to a seminal American legacy. the Statesman's Laylan Copelin:`` State Reps. Tom Craddick and Eddie Rodriguez are a political odd couple united by their legislation that payday lenders say will put them out of business.'' From the Statesman's Mike Pence Ward: Texans 70 and older would not have to show a photo ID to vote. People without a driver's license could get a free state photo ID card to vote. And people could use their concealed-handgun licenses to vote. Those are among the provisions of a voter ID bill the Gov. Rick Perry Senate approved late Wednesday and sent to the House, where approval also is expected. But both supporters and opponents predicted Thursday that the proposal will be changed some more before it gains final approval.
